structured_data.professional_summary: Data Scientist with 3 years of experience and a Master’s degree in Data Science - Computational Linguistics from The University of British Columbia. Skilled in developing data applications using machine learning and Large Language Models. Proven ability to lead end-to-end projects, from conceptualization to deployment. Expertise in designing and implementing ETL pipelines and building data warehouse infrastructure. Experienced in developing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions and fine-tuning Large Language Models. Strong background in fast-paced startup environments.

experience.responsibilities: Developed Iranian Newspaper Research Assistant, an application that makes previously non-searchable scanned historical newspaper and document archives searchable through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). Collected and converted scanned archives into machine-readable text, improving accessibility for researchers and historians. Implemented full-text and semantic search, enabling intuitive document retrieval. Developed graph-based search, allowing users to explore relationships between documents through graph visualizations. Built a chatbot-style assistant for intuitive natural language queries, allowing easy exploration of the archives.

Developed a custom Agentic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution from scratch, providing users with reliable and vetted data, advanced analytics, and visualizations via an intuitive chatbot interface. Fine-tuned Large Language Models to improve performance in semantic search, question answering, and function calling. Built web scraping tools, automating large-scale data collection from 50+ sources.

Sole data scientist responsible for designing and building a data warehouse, reducing reporting time by 70%. Designed and orchestrated scalable ETL pipelines integrating data from 11+ sources. Delivered actionable insights through connected dashboards for marketing, finance, and operations teams.

Developed a new semantic search system for BC Data Catalogue, improving search precision by 25% and recall by 40%. Developed topic modeling solution, providing users with interactive visualizations, improving BC Data Catalogue’s user experience. Received two awards for project presentation and was featured on the UBC website.
Automated data scraping pipelines to extract structured and unstructured data from 40+ sources. Developed and optimized ETL pipelines, improving data processing efficiency by 20%.

projects.title: Iranian Newspaper Research Assistant
projects.description: An application that makes previously non-searchable scanned historical newspaper and document archives searchable through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

years_exp: 3 years of experience in Data Science
profile:
Behrooz Qiassi is an accomplished Data Scientist with over three years of experience and a Master’s degree in Data Science with a focus on Computational Linguistics from the University of British Columbia. He specializes in designing and deploying advanced data applications powered by machine learning and Large Language Models (LLMs). Behrooz has a proven track record of leading end-to-end projects, including the development of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions and fine-tuning LLMs for enhanced semantic search and question-answering capabilities. His work has been recognized with multiple awards, including a Project Presentation Award and a feature on UBC’s website for his innovative contributions.

In his career, Behrooz has demonstrated a strong ability to deliver impactful solutions in fast-paced environments. As an independent consultant, he developed the Iranian Newspaper Research Assistant, a groundbreaking tool that transforms scanned historical archives into searchable, graphically visualized data, enhancing accessibility for researchers. At XYON Health, he built a scalable data warehouse and integrated data from over 11 sources, reducing reporting time by 70%. Additionally, during his tenure at Nu Data, he developed a custom Agentic RAG solution and fine-tuned LLMs to improve performance, showcasing his expertise in building scalable, intelligent systems for real-world applications.

Behrooz is highly skilled in a range of technologies, including Python, SQL, AWS, Docker, and advanced tools like LangChain and PyTorch. His technical acumen is complemented by a deep understanding of data orchestration, ETL pipelines, and data visualization, utilizing tools like Power BI and Plotly. Supported by a rich portfolio of impactful projects and a solid academic foundation, Behrooz continues to push the boundaries of data science and artificial intelligence, making him a valuable asset in any data-driven organization.

Converted scanned archives into machine-readable text to enhance research accessibility.
Implemented full-text and semantic search for intuitive document retrieval.

Improved BC Data Catalogue search precision by 25% and recall by 40% with a new semantic search system.
Created topic modeling solutions with interactive visualizations enhancing user experience.
Earned two awards for project presentation and recognition on UBC's website.
Automated data scraping pipelines to extract structured and unstructured data from over 40 sources.
Optimized ETL pipelines improving data processing efficiency by 20%.
